deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2062-08-30
CCU JAR Admit Note
Name: Jacob Goins
MR #: 6850327 (Please note that pt also has MRN 4033790)
Date of admission: 8/30/2062
Resident: Addison Keefe
Attending: Angel Vail
PCP: Felicia Ali
Source: Medical Record and Family
CC: L Arm Weakness
HPI: 28 yo RH M h/o DM1, ESRD on HD, HTN, Stroke (thought to be due to thrombocytosis), GTC in setting of HTN one year ago (and in June per family), multiple HTN episodes on many anti-hypertensives, RIJ thrombosis, had transient L arm weakness at HD followed by some difficulty speaking and change in his mental status. He was reportedly in good health the night prior to admission and the morning of admission per his family, with no sick contacts and no travel. At HD he was hypertensive with SBP in 200s, had transient L arm weakness and paresthesias which then resolved and had difficulty speaking and following commands after being noted by his nephrologist at an OSH to be mentating well with normal speech. No urinary/bowel incontinence, tonic-clonic movements or syncope was noted by his providers. He was brought to BMH ED because of these problems.
In the ED, his initial VS were BP 211/120 HR 88 T 98 R 18 SaO2 100% RA. he received a Head CT which showed no acute infarct or ICH , an MRI which showed no acute infarct on DWI, but he was agitated in the scanner and could not complete the study. He received 5 mg hydralazine iv x 2 and was started first in a TNG gtt and then on a nitroprusside gtt to 100/min titrated to a goal of MAP 120. His BP was 251/104 at 2315. and was His L Arm Weakness resolved, but he was agitated and he transiently wanted to leave AMA, and was admitted to the CCU for further management.
ROS: Per HPI. Other systems negative in detail
PMH:
a. Thrombocytosis
1. Followed by Dr. Morgan at BMH
1. -ve JAK2 mutation and -ve myeloproliferative w/u
2. Had high ferritin, low TIBC and high ESR levels when checked in the past.
3. On Hydrea
b. ESRD due to DM1 and HTN
1. Biopsy (3/62) with advanced diabetic glomerulopathy and secondary FSGS
2. Had R AVG (7/04) , now on HD x 1 month 3/wk.
3. Being evaluated for transplant
c. DM1 since age 11
1. HgbA1C 7.6 % in 7/62
2. Repeated hypoglycemic episodes in the past
3. Hx of DKA
d. HTN has had
e. Hyperlipidemia
f. Anemia
g. GTC in August last year and per family report, in June of this year - attributed to HTN. Was briefly on dilantin, but this was d/c'd due to side effects.
h. MRI with embolic foci in August 2061
1. w/u proved negative - attributed to thrombophilia

regular insulin 25 units qam sc 20 units qpm
ALL: NKDA

Lives with: Mother. Used to work at Bebo in Geologist, currently unemployed.
No EtOH, Illicits, Tobacco.
FH: HTN in parents, Mother with Stroke, Father on HD, DM1, DM2, CKD in other family members.
Physical Exam:

Gen: WDWN American male following commands intermittently.
HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, EOMF, sclera anicteric.
Neck: Supple, no thyromegaly, no carotid bruits, JVP flat

Cor: Tachy, RR S1, S2 nl. No m/r/g. + S3, prominent PMI.
Chest: CTAB anteriorly
Abdomen: +BS Soft, NT, ND. No HSM, No CVA tenderness. L para-umbilical bruit, no pulsatile mass.
Ext: No C/C/E, warm, well-perfused, subcutaneous mass on anterior R thigh, R AV fistula with thrill. 3+ DP and PT pulses b.l. Has indwelling L arterial line.
Skin: No rashes.
Neuro: A, O x 1 , PERRL, EOMF, Smile symmetric, Sensation grossly intact to light touch, Strength 5/5 in flexion and extension in upper and lower extremities. Reflexes 2+, toes downgoing.

A/P: 28 yo man with DM1, ESRD-HD, HTN, Hyperlipidemia, thrombocytosis, here with hypertensive emergency. His BP has remained high, so will attempt to reduce by 25% MAP for a few hours and then start an oral agent. Nitroprusside will be used first but if he needs an extended treatment, will change to nicardipine (Bj Q Sugudoyta 1165 Glb;7(9 Kk 1):414-8) given his ESRD. His change in mental status is likely due to hypertensive encephalopathy, but it is hard to exclude other sources of end-organ involvement such as the heart (especially considering his thrombocytosis) given his ongoing confusion. Other sources of his confusion might include meningitis given his leukocytosis.
1. CV
a. Pump
i. Has an S3, but no signs of L or R heart failure.
ii. Will reduce afterload prog
b. Rhythm
i. Sinus tachycardia, will give IVFs to reduce high-reninemic natriuretic state.
c. Ischemia
i. No EKG changes consistent with ischemia, will cycle cardiac biomarkers x 3, give ASA, Lipitor.
ii. Will reduce afterload with Nitroprusside, IVFs, po anti-hypertensives.
2. Neuro
a. His mental status and leukocytosis are likely due to hypertensive encephalopathy but potentially concerning for possible meningitis. Will perform lumbar puncture, hold Abx since he has been in the hospital for more than 6h, give if CSF studies indicate it.
b. Neuro following.
3. HTN
a. Will reduce MAP by 25% to ~100, will start with Nitroprusside, switch to Nicardipine. Will re-start some oral agents once reduced.
4. DM1
a. Will start half-dose of Insulin NPH, cover with RISS
5. Renal
a. Will need HD, will consult Renal.
6. Thrombocytosis
a. Stable, will consult Dr. Morgan's team re: continuing Hydroxyurea.
7. Access
a. L arterial line, peripheral iv.
8. F/E/N
a. IVFs, will start oral diet as mental status improves.
9. Heme
a. Has baseline anemia, likely currently hemoconcentrated, will montor Hct.
10. Prophylaxis
a. Senna, Colace, Nexium, Heparin.
